articles.author: Stacy Liberatore
articles.title: This is what the Earth and moon look like from Mars - Daily Mail
articles.description: ESA's Mars orbiter has been circling the Red Planet for 20 years and took a moment to look back home. The probe captured a rare view of the moon circling our planet 186.4 million miles away.
articles.content:
To the uninitiated, they may look like fuzzy white dots and blobs on a gray background. 
But what you're looking at is actually an incredibly rare snap of the Earth and the moon taken on Mars - 187 … [+5265 chars]
